metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3426 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
There's a flaw in Python 3's pydoc. A local or adjacent attacker who discovers or is able to convince another local or adjacent user to start a pydoc server could access the server and use it to disclose sensitive information belonging to the other user that they would not normally be able to access. The highest risk of this flaw is to data confidentiality. This flaw affects Python versions before 3.8.9, Python versions before 3.9.3 and Python versions before 3.10.0a7.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-3426` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.10 - 3.10.0~rc2-1build1
libpython3.10 - 3.10.0~rc2-1build1
libpython3.10-minimal - 3.10.0~rc2-1build1
libpython3.10-stdlib - 3.10.0~rc2-1build1
libpython3.10-testsuite - 3.10.0~rc2-1build1
python3.10 - 3.10.0~rc2-1build1
python3.10-examples - 3.10.0~rc2-1build1
python3.10-full - 3.10.0~rc2-1build1
python3.10-minimal - 3.10.0~rc2-1build1
python3.10-venv - 3.10.0~rc2-1build1
No subscription required

idle-python3.9 - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
libpython3.9 - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
libpython3.9-minimal - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
libpython3.9-stdlib - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
libpython3.9-testsuite - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
python3.9 - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
python3.9-examples - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
python3.9-full - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
python3.9-minimal - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
python3.9-venv - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> getfile introduced in 3.2.0 sbeattie> upstream fixed this by removing the getfile feature

criterions.comment: python3.10 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.10.0~rc2-1build1').
python3.9 package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.9.5-2ubuntu1').
